title: Grade 10 - Foundations of Mathematics and Pre-calculus 10 (2010)
subject: Mathematics

document.title: Grade 10 - Foundations of Mathematics and Pre-calculus 10 (2010)

564B99B487A341778ADD3AB21A3DD54A.description: Apply knowledge and skills with systems of linear equations to solve situational questions.

067659E6400749F984F7818E2509D990.description: Critique the statement “two lines always intersect at exactly one point”.

51C4194561AF443DA048B6F85B0EE05A.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies, including verification of solutions, for solving systems of equations algebraically.

8EAC56DA001F4B729FA7DC4376C246DE.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for solving systems of equations graphically, with and without the use of technology and verify the solutions.

217421D282A44280999BCC8AFEA9D3EC.description: Sketch, describe, provide and explain situational examples of the different ways that the graphs of two linear equations (two variables) can intersect and explain the meaning of the points of intersection.

92476070E93441D0B77FC248892C0C02.description: Match, with justification, situations and systems of linear equations.

0CB6182AF49141728B25BA55ACCD9970.description: Solve problems that involve systems of linear equations in two variables, graphically and algebraically.

673BB2FAF0CC4643B3ADA03B6893D730.description: Apply knowledge and skills of linear relations and their equations to solve situational questions.

6DDC0F6D0E584D4DB0906C1C1C97651D.description: Graph and write equations for linear data generated within an experiment or collected from a situation.

FB389ED0BA994D6081841750FE7AB299.description: Compare and critique the structure and purposes of different forms of linear relations, including y=mx+b, Ax+By=C, and y-y1 =m(x-x1 ) (e.g., there is no way to write a vertical linear relation in the form y = mx+b).

ED1E22117CA14D258E46C1DD351B15CC.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for writing an equation for a linear relation when given: a point that satisfies the relation and the slope of the relation, two points that satisfy the relation and the coordinates of a point that satisfy the relation and the equation of a line parallel or perpendicular to the line.

A1931594203B43CBA4C85470C09DD151.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for writing an equation for a linear relation using data obtained from a graph.

8A16F6396FBE426695BC68570CC32AF7.description: Demonstrate understanding of the writing and application of equations of linear relations, given: a graph of a relation, a point that satisfies a relation and the slope of the relation, two distinct points that satisfy a relation and a point that satisfies the relation and the equation of a line parallel or perpendicular to the relation.

7EE78089F50047DD8EECA9E7053D3913.description: Explain why a linear function would never have a term of x2 when in simplified form.

5A5DF4817CA4407BB9E5C59F87B15732.description: Determine the related domain value, given a range value for a linear function (e.g., if g(t) = 7 + t, determine t so that g(t) = 15) and explain what the resulting value tells about the linear function.

AB179A7FAB6E4B478904480663A2CE5F.description: Determine the related range value, given a domain value for a linear function (e.g., if f(x) = 3x – 2, determine f(–1)) and explain what the resulting value tells about the linear function.

1AF233EB60E94079A4514C7A6AD660F9.description: Apply knowledge and skills related to function notation to solve situational questions.

2617023443EC4D26BBD215E58E92361F.description: Explain the relationship between linear functions written in function notation and written as equations with two variables, and how to change between the two forms.

ADF06D6580434BE483E2409F65E5E4F4.description: Analyze a set of linear relations for equivalent linear relations (e.g., 2x +3y = 6 is equivalent to 4x + 6y = 12) and explain the reasoning.

56EB755160BA422FA0A3B842BFF2E6F1.description: Graph, with and without technology, a linear relation given in slope-intercept, general, or slope-point form, and explain the strategy used to create the graph.

6A1FEB3AB9EE4EF3A2E9EE3C95210840.description: Generalize, explain, and apply strategies for drawing or sketching the graph of a linear relation in slope-intercept, general, or slopepoint form, or function notation.

67DEB2A44AD24829A61FE89D3B155BBC.description: Express the equation of a linear relation in different forms (including the slope-intercept or general form) and compare the graphs of the linear relations.

A36C3B25E508487F933F6DCA7568FDCE.description: Solve a situational question that involves the intercepts, slope, domain, or range of a linear relation.

45FD33A7F5A6413CAA8C6B667534D954.description: Match, with explanation, slopes and y-intercepts to graphs of linear relations.

C212B8E2968D4A478BA92BD920505428.description: Sketch examples of linear relations to demonstrate the number of x or y intercepts possible for any line.

9653E6B627CC41B09BAFEB1F93DF9071.description: Determine the slope, domain, and range of the graph of a linear relation.

4AC0B01FCFB947A3AB956AF14AD701C9.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the intercepts (as values and ordered pairs) of a linear relation from its graph.

298B0F3486EA4AF5B3CEDF79EF0315DD.description: Match corresponding types of representations of linear relations (e.g., situations, graphs, tables of values, equations, and sets of ordered pairs).

50D659926859402281870C7453D7795C.description: Demonstrate understanding of linear relations including: representing in words, ordered pairs, tables of values, graphs, function notation, and equations, determining characteristics including intercepts, slope, domain, and range and relating different equation forms to each other and to graphs.

92A23C194CA243AE93BE77DBDEDFAAAB.description: Apply knowledge and skills related to slope to solve situational questions relevant to self, family, and community (e.g., determine the slopes of the poles in a tepee and the impact of changing the slopes on the dimensions and strength of the tepee).

62E59901444D43F8AAC4568ACDD3F2E3.description: Generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining whether two lines are parallel or perpendicular

79905068E4F04570AF9068A935DBD06F.description: Determine another point on a line, given the slope and a point on the line.

FF6FF3ACCBF647FCA18EA72810086373.description: Draw a line given its slope and a point on the line.

EF88B2234CC54D47A7CBB0ED8925C090.description: Explain why the slope of a straight line can be determined by using any two distinct points on that line.

85669F59D9664F36BBAC588374852EDD.description: Explain the meaning of zero or slopes with no Real value.

6630EDBDAD5745E59BBC9BD2DB64E865.description: Classify lines in a given set as having positive or negative slopes, and explain how the sign of the slope affects the interpretation or meaning of the slope.

003E9499EA0248BD813E2572C0D75EC4.description: Determine the slope of a line segment by using the measurement or calculation of the rise and run.

D7F9863E643B4167B68B3379001E5747.description: Illustrate and explain, using examples relevant to self, family, or community, how slope is rate of change.

314DEE9E5F694AFA85FCB210D6DD4AEA.description: Provide examples, relevant to self, family, or community, to explain the importance of slope

1DE2CE0992444ED3BAF2F893814C13E4.description: Demonstrate, with and without the use of technology, understanding of slope (concretely, pictorially, and symbolically) with respect to: line segments and lines • rate of change, ratio of rise to run, parallel lines and perpendicular lines.

39B8319509494001B7D8E054F7B80865.description: Generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining whether a set of ordered pairs or a graph represents a function.

87D151E32F224E8C8E89C4617D74D4DE.description: Determine, and express in a variety of ways, the domain and range of a graph, a set of ordered pairs, or a table of values.

3D530729F07B4FFA97527CEFB6738BB1.description: Sketch a graph to represent a situation presented orally or in writing.

B984634D8A4D42689BC49C6C548DA41D.description: Provide and explain examples of situations that could be represented by a given graph.

39CC3D610B234AF7BEF26FC84851D9CA.description: Explain why data points should or should not be connected on the graph for a situation.

96DD4B620B014391A759154743811636.description: Graph, with or without technology, a set of data, and determine the restrictions on the domain and range.

4542AB197CB743098499ADE10DC4626E.description: Critique the statement “Relations and functions are the same thing”.

48C20E048EE74A9C9D1AB7EAA70AFD62.description: Explain, by providing situational and graphical examples, the relationship between the categories of “relations” and “functions”.

0DAA78FA73574E919E22D74055E77E84.description: Provide and discuss examples of different types of relations relevant to one’s life, family, or community (e.g., person A is the mother of person B, or person A is a brother of person B.).

34C936D1641E4C78800D8648A414CEE8.description: Expand and apply understanding of relations and functions including: relating data, graphs, and situations, analyzing and interpreting and distinguishing between relations and functions.

D19FA8FE35F1437DB94479F12B39C41C.description: Explain why it is important to look for common factors first when factoring a trinomial.

BA61A908417D43AB81FC89436EB64587.description: Explain how differences of squares can be factored using trinomial factoring strategies.

28956665286E48CEA989845452C23B6E.description: Critique the statement “any trinomial can be factored into two binomial factors”.

D7BC0EB3F7884072B4C650EBCB9681E2.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for factoring a trinomial.

9E52FC06B817465C8D9E4962047612AA.description: Explain and apply strategies for determining whether given factors are those of a given polynomial.

757BA75B52AA4A2F81279BB035A84D7E.description: Sort a set of polynomials according to the type(s) of factoring that could be applied to them.

2A6685AFC8DA434BA37C74128C071401.description: Develop (using concrete materials, pictures, or visualization), generalize, explain, and apply strategies for factoring and verifying the factors of binomials, including numerical binomial expressions (e.g., 32+20=4(8+5)).

8DAE0FF18B144BB3A74BAF3E6B7C7391.description: Explain, using concrete or visual models, how the processes of factoring and multiplication are related.

A93DA9D2A32C41C4B7004F2AF4E11633.description: Explain why evaluating at a value for the variable in a product of polynomials in factored form should give the same solution as evaluating the expanded and simplified form of the polynomial product at the same value (e.g., explain why x2 +5x+6 should have the same value as (x+3)(x+2) when evaluated at x = -4).

82FF34DA73A74854A53B9FE754561CF4.description: Analyze the multiplication of two polynomials for errors and explain the strategy used.

59B218B2F0AF41298466431155449C4E.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply a strategy for multiplying polynomials.

448B38C5C16E4EEBAE25D9304F295B05.description: Develop (concretely, pictorially, or symbolically), explain, and apply understanding of how multiplication of binomials is related to the multiplication of two-digit numbers (e.g., use algebra tiles and base ten blocks to compare and relate the products of (x+1)(3x+2) and (11)(32) ).

E694AA004B29497A8944977524EDB274.description: Explain the relationship between the multiplication of two binomial expressions and the area of a rectangular region.

CED0BAD552374A569AB067390EFB9D9B.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply a strategy of symbolic manipulation to determine the product of two binomials by analyzing concrete and pictorial models.

D6D2AAEC916545698AD0A8A201AD6508.description: Demonstrate understanding of the multiplication and factoring of polynomial expressions (concretely, pictorially, and symbolically) including: multiplying of monomials, binomials, and trinomials, common factors, trinomial factoring and relating multiplication and factoring of polynomials.

BCAB9C802C7540C392292794655D533D.description: Create and solve problems that involve indirect and direct linear measurements by using the primary trigonometric ratios, the Pythagorean Theorem, and measurement instruments such as a clinometer or metre stick.

AA5E3CC35C4643468BE2E1EBB48BE959.description: Solve problems, with or without the use of technology, involving one or more right triangles by applying primary trigonometric ratios and/or the Pythagorean Theorem.

17A5EF233EA84D97A9D5B661DF8B2658.description: Demonstrate how to identify the hypotenuse of a right triangle and the adjacent and opposite sides to an acute angle in that right triangle.

46DD823FCEF544D3AF9CFAAAE287F0C9.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply relationships between the ratios of side lengths and angle sizes in similar right triangles.

860835527BAD4F0F9BB8FEA6FB54698F.description: Develop and apply the primary trigonometric ratios (sine, cosine, tangent) to solve problems that involve right triangles.

FCE2FAC3F03444FBA73282A0F9476EA2.description: Analyze a treaty for its inclusion of measurements, such as in the surveying for land entitlement, and create and solve situational questions that are relevant to self, family, and community.

669153C3CC1645E7A6DD15CCF0B86438.description: Explain the relationship between the volumes of: right cones and right cylinders with the same base and height and right pyramids and right prisms with the same base and height.

D588A4766DA0479BAA5D9CC2EA1BDCD9.description: Apply formulas to determine the surface area and/or volume of spheres.

392E05DAF2D2477DA19CC7904FC790A5.description: Solve, using personal strategies and/or formulas, situational questions related to surface area, volume, and dimensions of right cones, cylinders, prisms, and pyramids, and composite 3-D objects.

533A506B14B441369DB16C1805859C47.description: Analyze 3-D objects, their nets, and labelled diagrams to develop and generalize strategies and/or formulas for determining the surface area and volume of right cones, cylinders, prisms, and pyramids and composite objects

BD6AE5A377D94AC08883AA404CDD549D.description: Verify, with explanation (such as unit analysis and/or mental mathematics and estimation), a conversion of units (within the SI or imperial systems of measurement or between them).

EA9B24DF5620450FB776F148D4445584.description: Develop, generalize, explain and apply strategies and/or formulas for converting between: SI and imperial units of linear, surface area, and volume measure and imperial and SI units of linear, surface area, and volume measure.

F4EF90C7C2EA48849F30E1CABF10D7B4.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies and/or formulas for converting between units within the imperial or SI system of measurements, limited to linear, surface area, and volume units. (e.g., converting square feet to square yards or m3 to cm3 ).

7A19C2D27C7E462795A2DDF8BABB2503.description: Compare the size of SI and imperial units of measurement (linear, surface area, and volume) using referents.

B0F69CC8787C4FCA9544155473E25553.description: Critique the statement “the length of the wall is greater in yards than it is in metres”.

94EA541DD2ED4873B6C5BEA4B90D400C.description: Explain the selection of measurement instruments (e.g., rulers, callipers, or tape measures) and the strategies used to determine linear measurements (e.g., circumference of a bottle, length of a curve, or perimeter of the base of an irregular 3-D object).

F4241D8779CE4E0B95FE0916103DD343.description: Justify the choice of units and or referents for determining or estimating linear, surface area, or volume measurements in different contexts.

F138CD70CFE04992BE7BFD6D20B86207.description: Provide personal referents for linear measurements, including millimetre, centimetre, metre, kilometre, inch, foot, yard, and mile and explain the choices

4BC83554496D462099FB22C462497E24.description: Demonstrate understanding of SI and imperial units of measurement including: linear measurement, surface area of spheres, and right cones, cylinders, prisms, and pyramids, volume of spheres, and right cones, cylinders, prisms, and pyramids and relationships between and within measurement systems

8853D0BC86004C63BB9EC9C6724E2B64.description: Create a representation that conveys the relationship between powers, rational numbers, and irrational numbers.

BC57512C2C354D2BA75D40D42DE90074.description: Express powers with rational exponents as radicals and vice versa.

EA147D83C42D4D73AAE41DFB6D029387.description: Analyze simplifications of expressions involving radicals and/or powers for errors.

5B298602F1DE47C89D896D03DA75CFCB.description: Extend and apply the exponent laws to powers with rational exponents (limited to expressions with rational and variable bases and integral and rational exponents): (a^m)(a^n)= a^(m+n) , (a^m)/(a^n)=a^(m-n), a?0, (a^m)^n=a^nm, (ab)^n= a^m b^m, (a/b)^m=a^m/b^m, b?0

3AD7EB7220BF49A1AEADCBC33DB6EEE6.description: Analyze patterns to generalize why a1/n=n?a, n?0, n?I  when n is an even integer

509245F78B3E41E1A972B520FF7E1909.description: Analyze patterns to generalize why a-n=1/an. a?0.

D52B59AA2C784E6798645244C6B84E0E.description: Represent, such as through the use of a graphic organizer, the relationships among the subsets of the Real numbers: natural, whole, integer, rational, and irrational

D1E381FD5A89420DAC7BED4C97190808.description: Explain, using examples, how changing the value of the index of a radical impacts the value of the radical.

5163645B5A4040CE8C081148D9DE5C98.description: Express a mixed radical as an entire radical (limited to numerical radicands).

FDE83E346BD6485E97E73CFC960243E8.description: Express a radical as a mixed radical in simplest form (limited to numerical radicands).

5B958FD7BE1E42ECB0D75A4706C71554.description: Order a set of Real numbers, including rational and irrational numbers, on a number line and explain the strategies used.

CCFB57AAAB494ADEAB71AC924EF01E79.description: Approximate the value of a given irrational number and explain the strategy used.

A8D2BE4E87B7449389C3D04218995134.description: Create and explain a pattern that describes the decimal form of an irrational number (e.g., write the digits from 0 to 9 in order, then put two of each digit – 0011223344 … – followed by three of each digit and so on).

D86DBBD7218345D3AE74B2FC689E7AF9.description: Sort, with justification, a set of numbers into rational and irrational numbers.

81CC4D45E1444430AC1A7A72F724C89B.description: Demonstrate understanding of irrational numbers in both radical (including mixed radical) and exponent forms through: representing, identifying, simplifying, ordering, relating to rational numbers and applying exponent laws.

D9D27279877744DBAE616A998E02D824.description: Solve problems that involve prime factors, greatest common factors, least common multiples, square roots, or cube roots.

73A9CC05D64842AA9B0D423D70798AF3.description: Investigate and report about the numbers 0 and 1 with respect to factors, multiples, square roots, and cube roots.

570832476DE14B9F96619D829208E02A.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the square root of a perfect square and the cube root of a perfect cube.

9B8B2F4322474D85A4A9EBB965964827.description: Analyze concretely, pictorially, or numerically and explain whether a whole number is a perfect square or a perfect cube.

574F5E2A936C45B58C98B11F18F1DABF.description: Determine the prime factors of a whole number and explain the strategies used.

478952495B874BCA95466BA133D61450.description: Explain the relationship between factors and multiples.

5A2543CCF6CD44B6AAABEDE6C26BE94C.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the greatest common factors or least common multiples.

77F76CC747564D53B25907A9FEE3F660.description: Demonstrate understanding of factors of whole numbers by determining the: prime factors, greatest common factor, least common multiple, principal square root and cube root.
